snippet: Most of the senior officials of Tunisia’s former government have been released from prison, raising accusations of injustice from relatives of victims and human rights activists in the wake of the 2011 Arab Spring uprising.
abstract: Some of the most powerful and hated figures of Tunisia's former government under ousted president Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali have been released from prison, beneficiaries of shift in balance of power in Tunisia and growing leniency by military tribunals trying them; move is raising accusations of injustice from relatives of victims and human rights activists in wake of 2011 Arab Spring uprising.
lead_paragraph: Most of the senior officials of Tunisia’s former government have been released from prison, raising accusations of injustice from relatives of victims and human rights activists in the wake of the 2011 Arab Spring uprising.

headline.main: Questions of Justice in Tunisia as Ousted Leaders Are Freed
headline.print_headline: Questions of Justice in Tunisia as Ousted Leaders Are Freed
